info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 14 at 12:19PM CDT until June 17 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 100 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN CASS...SOUTHWESTERN BOWIE...NORTHERN MORRIS... NORTHEASTERN TITUS AND SOUTHEASTERN RED RIVER COUNTIES... At 1219 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Us 259 And I 30 Intersection, or 15 miles southeast of Boxelder, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... New Boston, Hooks, De Kalb, Naples, Maud, Omaha, Us 259 And I 30 Intersection, Dalby Springs, Douglassville, Marietta, Spring Hill, Lydia and Bryans Mill. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: This storm is producing destructive winds and large damaging hail. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
